messages.message:
anyone know what caused docker to crash like this? happened right after I used provisioner to stop account-tservice, which was not running as docker
actually, seems to not be causing any issues anymore!

oh yea provisioner stop seems to behave very badly if the thing isn't actually running as a docker container. it uses a process search to get the pid and kills it. but seems like often that pid is not the service but some other important process
in general, I try to avoid stopping any services that aren't actually running
someone who is better with process and pids should probably fix the bug. maybe @Karthik S knows?
We used to see similar issues long time back when stop all was issued.  If there's a pending docker update, do update it and restart the docker daemon.
